original_title: How Much Bull Can You Take - Part Nine
overview: Story ONE:  A Current Day Bounty Hunter; Dogger Don... For over 150 years the wild dog has been Australia’s number one pastoral predator. Surviving baits, bullets & traps has resulted in a super evasive breed and livestock losses are extreme. The affected graziers are having to look at both traditional and unconventional protection measures. Come follow the bush beat of a rifle toting, bike juggling bounty hunter… What is Dogger Don’s secret to catch a super stealthy breed?  Story TWO: Pin The Tail on The Wild Donkey... Extreme wild dog attacks on livestock have increased an interest in employing donkeys as guardian animals. Toughness and cunning are a few attributes that have helped the feral ass survive in isolated outback pockets. Wild donkey trapping and aerial mustering are not so common. On the other hand, ground running of wild ass is considered just impossible! Come see the donkey runners and tailers from the back of Bourke achieve this bike n butt busting feat.
title: How Much Bull Can You Take - Part Nine
